content: TITLE: Creating Standard Markdown Links in Docfx Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create hyperlinks using the standard markdown link syntax to absolute or relative URLs and how Docfx renders these links to HTML anchors. The snippet shows creating domain-independent links with paths starting from the root ('/'). Required input is markdown source including an inline link, with output as the corresponding HTML anchor. It supports referencing local files and external URLs. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/links-and-cross-references.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` [docfx](https://dotnet.github.io/docfx) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Referencing Resources by UID Using Markdown Autolink Syntax DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using xref autolink syntax to reference resources by UID in markdown documents. This link format automatically uses the referenced resource's title as link text. Requires that the UID exists and is properly registered in Docfx or imported xrefmaps. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/links-and-cross-references.md#_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Documenting Code with XML Comments in C# DESCRIPTION: This C# code snippet demonstrates the use of XML comments to document a method. The comments provide a summary, parameter descriptions, return value description, and remarks about the code. Docfx uses these XML comments to generate API documentation. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/basic-concepts.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: C# CODE: ``` /// /// Calculates the age of a person on a certain date based on the supplied date of birth. Takes account of leap years, /// using the convention that someone born on 29th February in a leap year is not legally one year older until 1st March /// of a non-leap year. /// /// Individual's date of birth. /// Date at which to evaluate age at. /// Age of the individual in years (as an integer). /// This code is not guaranteed to be correct for non-UK locales, as some countries have skipped certain dates /// within living memory. public static int AgeAt(this DateOnly dateOfBirth, DateOnly date) { int age = date.Year - dateOfBirth.Year; return dateOfBirth > date.AddYears(-age) ? --age : age; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Automating DocFX Deployment to GitHub Pages (YAML) DESCRIPTION: Configures a GitHub Actions workflow triggered on pushes to the `main` branch. It checks out the code, sets up .NET, installs/updates `docfx`, builds the documentation using a specified `docfx.json` path, uploads the generated `_site` folder as a pages artifact, and deploys it to GitHub Pages. Requires `` to be replaced with the actual path to the DocFX project directory containing `docfx.json`. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/index.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` # Your GitHub workflow file under .github/workflows/ # Trigger the action on push to main on: push: branches: - main # Sets permissions of the GITHUB_TOKEN to allow deployment to GitHub Pages permissions: actions: read pages: write id-token: write # Allow only one concurrent deployment, skipping runs queued between the run in-progress and latest queued. # However, do NOT cancel in-progress runs as we want to allow these production deployments to complete. concurrency: group: "pages" cancel-in-progress: false jobs: publish-docs: environment: name: github-pages url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }} runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - name: Checkout uses: actions/checkout@v3 - name: Dotnet Setup uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v3 with: dotnet-version: 8.x - run: dotnet tool update -g docfx - run: docfx /docfx.json - name: Upload artifact uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3 with: # Upload entire repository path: '/_site' - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages id: deployment uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Shorthand UID Cross Reference Syntax in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Shows the shorthand xref form using '@{uid}' to create quick references to other files by UID within markdown content. This syntax requires specific character rules for valid reference recognition to reduce false positives. When resolved, it renders with a link using the target title as link text. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/links-and-cross-references.md#_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` see @file1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building a DocFX Project (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Executes the `docfx` command with the project configuration file (`docfx.json`) to generate the static documentation files without starting a local server. This is typically used after making local changes or before publishing, outputting files to the `_site` directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/index.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docfx docfx.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing DocFX Global Tool DESCRIPTION: This command installs DocFX as a global .NET tool. This allows you to use DocFX from the command line. Prerequisites include the .NET SDK. The output is the installation confirmation. There are no specific limitations. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` dotnet tool install -g docfx ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Executing the Build Step with Docfx CLI DESCRIPTION: This shell command demonstrates how to execute the build step of the Docfx process using the command line interface. It specifies the path to the `docfx.json` configuration file. The `--serve` option starts a local web server for previewing the output. This step converts Markdown content into HTML and applies templates and themes. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/basic-concepts.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` docfx build path/to/docfx.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Build Content Files (Expanded Form) in DocFX (JSON) DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates the expanded form for defining content file mappings in the `build` section of `docfx.json`. It allows specifying source directories (`src`), destination folders (`dest`), explicit file patterns (`files` using glob syntax), and exclusion patterns (`exclude`). In this example, it maps Markdown files from a `docs` subfolder to a `docs` destination and maps YAML/Markdown files from a parallel `api` folder to an `api` destination, excluding any file containing 'Private'. Files are resolved relative to the `src` directory if specified, otherwise relative to the `docfx.json` location. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-json-reference.md#_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "build": { "content": [ {"files": "docs/**/*.md", "dest": "docs"}, {"files": ["**/*.yml", "*.md"], "exclude": ["**/*Private*"], "src": "../api", "dest": "api" } ] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Reference Assemblies for Metadata Generation DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet configures Docfx to include external reference assemblies during the metadata generation phase. It specifies a list of paths to DLLs. This is crucial when the assembly being documented depends on other assemblies that may not be in the same directory or the global assembly cache. It helps resolve dependencies during reflection. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/dotnet-api-docs.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "metadata": { "src": [{ "files": ["**/bin/Release/**.dll"], "src": "../" }], "dest": "api", "references": [ "path-to-reference-assembly.dll" ] }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding xrefmap Path to docfx.json for Cross Project Referencing DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to configure a Docfx project to consume an external xrefmap file by adding its path or URL to the 'xref' array in the build section of docfx.json. This enables cross project cross references using UIDs defined in the imported map. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/links-and-cross-references.md#_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: JSON CODE: ``` { "build": { "xref": [ "" ], ... } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Structuring Unit Tests in C# with xUnit.net DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the ideal structure for writing unit tests in C#. It enforces the Arrange-Act-Assert pattern to improve test clarity and reliability, ensuring that the action being tested is a single statement. It also shows how to test for specific exceptions by verifying exception messages using Assert.Throws. Dependencies include the xUnit.net testing framework. Input parameters involve setting up test data in the arrange phase, and the output is verification of expected behavior or exception through assertions. This structure avoids ambiguous failures caused by complex parameter creation within the action statement. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/samples/seed/articles/csharp_coding_standards.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: C# CODE: ``` // Arrange P1 p1 = GetComplexParam1(); P2 p2 = GetComplexParam2(); P3 p3 = GetComplexParam3(); // Act int result = myObj.CallSomeMethod(p1, p2, p3); // Assert Assert.AreEqual(1234, result); ``` LANGUAGE: C# CODE: ``` var ex = Assert.Throws( () => fruitBasket.GetBananaById(1234)); Assert.Equal( "1234", ex.Message); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Describing C# Object Class Metadata YAML DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet represents a metadata file structure for the C# Object class. It defines the 'items' section, including unique identifiers (UIDs), parent-child relationships, and illustrates how class members are organized within the hierarchical structure. It is used to generate reference documentation, showcasing item properties like UID, parent, and children. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/spec/metadata_format_spec.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` items: - uid: System.Object parent: System children: - System.Object.Object() - System.Object.Equals(System.Object) - System.Object.Equals(System.Object,System.Object) - System.Object.Finalize() - System.Object.GetHashCode() - System.Object.GetType() - System.Object.MemberwiseClone() - System.Object.ReferenceEquals() - System.Object.ToString() - uid: System.Object.Object() parent: System.Object - uid: System.Object.Equals(System.Object) parent: System.Object - uid: System.Object.Equals(System.Object,System.Object) parent: System.Object - uid: System.Object.Finalize() parent: System.Object - uid: System.Object.GetHashCode() parent: System.Object - uid: System.Object.GetType() parent: System.Object - uid: System.Object.MemberwiseClone() parent: System.Object - uid: System.Object.ReferenceEquals() parent: System.Object - uid: System.Object.ToString() parent: System.Object references: ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filter API by Type DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet demonstrates excluding APIs based on their type using the `type` property, in conjunction with `uidRegex`. This filters out APIs whose UID starts with `Microsoft.DevDiv` and are also of type `Type`. This enables precise control over API exclusion based on both identifier and the type. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/dotnet-api-docs.md#_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiRules: - exclude: uidRegex: ^Microsoft\.DevDiv type: Type ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting PDF Generation Timeout in DocFX DESCRIPTION: The `DOCFX_PDF_TIMEOUT` environment variable specifies the maximum time, in milliseconds, to override the default Playwright timeout for PDF generation. The timeout controls how long DocFX will wait for PDF generation to complete. The input is a number representing time in milliseconds. It impacts the `docfx pdf` command to customize PDF generation, preventing it from running indefinitely in some circumstances. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-environment-variables-reference.md#_snippet_4 ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Referencing DocFX NuGet Libraries in a .NET Project (XML) DESCRIPTION: Shows the `` elements to add to a `.csproj` file to include the `Docfx.App` library and specific, matching versions of `Microsoft.CodeAnalysis` dependencies. This enables programmatic interaction with DocFX build processes. Version numbers for CodeAnalysis must align exactly with the `Docfx.App` build requirements. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/index.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Metadata Extraction in docfx.json `metadata` Section DESCRIPTION: Shows a sample configuration for the `metadata` section, which controls the `docfx metadata` command. It defines an array of metadata projects. Each project specifies source files (`src` using File Mappings, here targeting `.csproj` files in `../src` while excluding `bin`/`obj`) and the destination directory (`dest`) for the generated metadata YAML files. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-json-reference.md#_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "metadata": [ { "src": [ { "files": ["**/*.csproj"], "exclude": [ "**/bin/**", "**/obj/**" ], "src": "../src" } ], "dest": "api" } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Markdown Link Syntax with Xref Schema for Cross References DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create cross references by combining standard markdown link syntax with the 'xref:' schema in the URL to target a UID resource. This allows custom link text to be displayed, differing from autolink which uses the target's title. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/links-and-cross-references.md#_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` [link text](xref:file1) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Startup Scripts in Modern Template JS DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the structure for adding custom JavaScript code that executes on page load within a modern template's `main.js` file (`my-template/public/main.js`). The initialization logic should be placed inside the exported object's `start` function. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/template.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` export default { start: () => { // Startup script goes here }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering UID-Based Autolink to HTML Anchor DESCRIPTION: Shows the HTML anchor generated from a markdown xref autolink. The anchor href points to the resolved html page for the referenced UID and the link text is the title of the linked topic. This output is dynamically generated by Docfx based on cross reference metadata. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/links-and-cross-references.md#_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ``` This is file1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Loading Global Metadata from External Files in docfx.json DESCRIPTION: Shows how to load global metadata from external JSON files using the `globalMetadataFiles` property within the `build` section. Provide an array of file paths relative to `docfx.json`. Metadata from these files will be applied globally. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-json-reference.md#_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "build": { "globalMetadataFiles": ["global1.json", "global2.json"] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering Xref Markdown Link to HTML Anchor with Custom Text DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the HTML anchor output generated for embedded UID cross reference links using standard markdown syntax with 'xref:' URLs. The href corresponds to the resolved topic and the inner text is explicitly specified in markdown. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/links-and-cross-references.md#_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ``` link text ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring DocFX Post-Processors in docfx.json (JSON) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure custom or built-in post-processors within the `docfx.json` build settings. The `postProcessors` array specifies the names of the processors to run, in the order listed, after the main build process completes. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/tutorial/howto_add_a_customized_post_processor.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "build": { ... "postProcessors": ["OutputPDF", "BeautifyHTML", "OutputPDF"] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Getting Contact Manager Link via REST API DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to retrieve a link to the manager object for a specific contact using the Azure AD Graph API. It targets the contacts resource collection, specifies the contact by its object ID, and uses the /$links/manager segment to get the relationship link. The request requires a valid access token and tenant identifier. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/test/Docfx.Build.RestApi.Tests/TestData/contacts-operations.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: HTTP Request CODE: ``` GET https://graph.windows.net/myorganization/contacts/a2fb3752-08b4-413d-af6f-1d99c4c131d9/$links/manager?api-version=1.6 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining DocFX LandingPage Schema in JSON DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet provides a formal schema definition that validates and describes the landing page YAML structure for DocFX. It specifies types, custom keywords (like 'xrefProperties', 'tags', 'mergeType'), and how to merge or interpret properties. The schema must be referenced using the "$schema" attribute and includes structured rules for required keys, custom operations on sections, and integration with DocFX conventions. Requires JSON Schema support for usage. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/spec/docfx_document_schema.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "$schema": "https://dotnet.github.io/docfx/schemas/v1.0/schema.json#", "version": "1.0.0", "id": "https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/schemas/landingpage.schema.json", "title": "LandingPage", "description": "The schema for landing page", "type": "object", "xrefProperties": [ "title", "description" ], "properties": { "metadata": { "type": "object", "tags": [ "metadata" ] }, "uid": { "type": "string", "contentType": "uid" }, "sections": { "type": "array", "items": { "type": "object", "properties": { "children": { "type": "array", "items": { "type": "object", "properties": { "href": { "type": "string", "contentType": "href" }, "text": { "type": "string", "tags": [ "localizable" ] }, "content": { "type": "string", "contentType": "markdown" } } } }, "title": { "type": "string", "mergeType": "key" } } } }, "title": { "type": "string" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cross Referencing Using UID Metadata in Docfx Markdown Files DESCRIPTION: Introduces using the 'uid' metadata property to assign a unique identifier to a markdown file, enabling cross referencing by UID rather than file path. This facilitates path-independent linking within and across projects. The snippet shows how to set UID in markdown YAML front matter. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/links-and-cross-references.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` --- uid: file1 --- # This is file1 ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cross-Referencing Items using xref URI in DocFX Markdown DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the standard ways to create cross-references to other documentation items within DocFX Markdown using the `xref` URI scheme. It shows both the standard Markdown link syntax `[text](uri)` and the automatic link syntax `` to reference an item by its unique identifier (UID), allowing navigation between related documentation. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/spec/metadata_format_spec.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [System.String](xref:System.String) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Markup Parsing in XML Documentation DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet disables markdown parsing within the XML documentation comments. This is useful when XML documentation contains markup that is not intended to be parsed as markdown. Setting `shouldSkipMarkup` to `true` prevents unintended rendering issues, allowing XML tags to render correctly. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/dotnet-api-docs.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "metadata": { "src": [{ "files": ["**/bin/Release/**.dll"], "src": "../" }], "dest": "api", "shouldSkipMarkup": true } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example `build` Section Configuration in docfx.json DESCRIPTION: Provides a sample configuration for the `build` section, which governs settings for the `docfx build` command. This example specifies patterns for including content files (`.md`, `.yml`) and resource files (`media/**`), and sets a global metadata variable `_appTitle`. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-json-reference.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "build": { "content": ["**/*.{md|yml}"], "resource": ["**/media/**"], "globalMetadata": { "_appTitle": "My App" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring MSBuild Properties in DocFX Metadata (JSON) DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows how to define MSBuild properties within the `metadata` array in `docfx.json`. It specifically sets the `TargetFramework` property to `netstandard2.0`, which is necessary when a project targets multiple platforms. These properties are passed to MSBuild during metadata generation, similar to the `/property:name=value` command-line argument. Note that when generating metadata directly from source files, only `DefineConstants` and `AllowUnsafeBlocks` are supported. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-json-reference.md#_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "metadata": [ { "properties": { "TargetFramework": "netstandard2.0" } } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enforcing Class Member Ordering in C# DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the mandatory order of class member definitions in C#, starting from the least restrictive (public) to the most restrictive (private). This ordering includes nested types, fields, constructors, finalizers, methods, and private nested types. Following this order helps maintain code consistency and readability across the codebase. No specific dependencies are required, but usage of StyleCop or FxCop can enforce this rule. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/samples/seed/articles/csharp_coding_standards.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` The class definition contains class members in the following order, from less restricted scope (public) to more restrictive (private): * Nested types, e.g. classes, enum, struct, etc. * Field members, e.g. member variables, const, etc. * Member functions * Constructors * Finalizer (Do not use unless absolutely necessary) * Methods (Properties, Events, Operations, Overridables, Static) * Private nested types ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Generated sitemap.xml Output from DocFX DESCRIPTION: Provides an example of the `sitemap.xml` file that DocFX can generate based on the configuration in the `sitemap` property. It adheres to the sitemap protocol, listing URLs (``) along with metadata like last modification date (``), change frequency (``), and priority (``). SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-json-reference.md#_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` https://dotnet.github.io/docfx/api/System.String.html 2001-01-01T00:00:00.00+08:00 monthly 0.3 https://dotnet.github.io/docfx/conceptual/GettingStarted.html 2017-09-21T10:00:00.00+08:00 daily 0.3 https://dotnet.github.io/docfx/ReadMe.html 2017-09-21T10:00:00.00+08:00 monthly 0.1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mapping C# Constructors to YAML Items DESCRIPTION: Provides C# examples of a parameterless constructor and a constructor with parameters for the `String` class. The associated YAML shows how constructors are represented, using `#ctor` for the `id` (optionally followed by parameter type UIDs in parentheses) and including language-specific names and full names. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/dotnet-yaml-format.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` namespace System { public sealed class String { public String(); public String(char[] chars); } } ``` LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` - uid: System.String.#ctor id: #ctor name.csharp: String() fullName.csharp: System.String.String() - uid: System.String.#ctor(System.Char[]) id: #ctor(System.Char[]) name.csharp: String(Char[]) fullName.csharp: System.String.String(System.Char[]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example xrefmap.yml Structure Generated by Docfx DESCRIPTION: Shows the YAML format of the xrefmap file generated by Docfx during build. It contains a list of references with UID, display name, href URL, and optional fullName (for API references). This file is used to share UID mappings across projects for consistent cross referencing. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/links-and-cross-references.md#_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: YAML CODE: ``` references: - uid: uid_of_topic name: title_of_topic href: url_of_topic.html fullName: full_title_of_topic - ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Representing C# Methods in YAML Format DESCRIPTION: Shows C# method overloads (`ToString()`, `ToString(IFormatProvider)`) and their corresponding YAML representation. It highlights how the method `id` includes the method name and a parenthesized list of parameter type UIDs (required even for parameterless methods), and the `name.csharp` reflects the C# signature. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/dotnet-yaml-format.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` namespace System { public sealed class String { public String ToString(); public String ToString(IFormatProvider provider); } } ``` LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` - uid: System.String.ToString() id: ToString() name.csharp: ToString() fullName.csharp: System.String.ToString() - uid: System.String.ToString(System.IFormatProvider) id: ToString(System.IFormatProvider) name.csharp: ToString(IFormatProvider) fullName.csharp: System.String.ToString(System.IFormatProvider) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining DocFX Post-Processor Class (C#) DESCRIPTION: Defines the basic C# class structure for a custom DocFX post-processor. It implements the `IPostProcessor` interface and uses the `[Export]` attribute from `System.Composition` to make the class discoverable by the DocFX plugin system. This is the entry point for the custom logic. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/tutorial/howto_add_a_customized_post_processor.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` [Export(nameof(MyProcessor), typeof(IPostProcessor))] public class MyProcessor : IPostProcessor { // TODO: implements IPostProcessor } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Representing C# Explicit Interface Implementations in YAML DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a C# explicit implementation of `IEnumerable.GetEnumerator` within the `String` class. The YAML shows how the `uid` and `id` are constructed by prefixing the member name with the interface's UID, replacing dots within the interface name with hash symbols (`System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator`). SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/dotnet-yaml-format.md#_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` namespace System { using System.Collections; public sealed class String : IEnumerable { IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator(); } } ``` LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` - uid: "System.String.System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator" id: "System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator" name.csharp: IEnumerable.GetEnumerator() fullName.csharp: System.String.System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mapping C# Operator Overloads to YAML DESCRIPTION: Provides C# examples for an implicit conversion operator and the equality operator (`==`). The corresponding YAML demonstrates how these operators are represented, using metadata names like `op_Implicit` or `op_Equality` in the `id` and `uid`, and user-friendly names like `Implicit(Char to Decimal)` or `Equality(String,String)` in `name.csharp`. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/dotnet-yaml-format.md#_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` namespace System { public struct Decimal { public static implicit operator Decimal(Char value); } public sealed class String { public static bool operator ==(String a, String b); } } ``` LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` - uid: System.Decimal.op_Implicit(System.Char)~System.Decimal id: op_Implicit(System.Char)~System.Decimal name.csharp: Implicit(Char to Decimal) fullName.csharp: System.Decimal.Implicit(System.Char to System.Decimal) - uid: System.String.op_Equality(System.String,System.String) id: op_Equality(System.String,System.String) name.csharp: Equality(String,String) fullName.csharp: System.String.Equality(System.String,System.String) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Absolute Path Referencing for Local Files in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Shows referencing a local markdown file using an absolute path relative to the docfx.json root using the '~/` syntax. This method simplifies link maintenance by avoiding complex relative paths. Requirements include proper docfx.json configuration and that target files are included in the project to prevent build warnings. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/links-and-cross-references.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` [file1](~/subfolder/file2.md) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Language-Specific Property Values in DocFX YAML DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to define different values for a documentation item property based on the target programming language within DocFX's YAML metadata. This is achieved by appending the language name (e.g., `.csharp`, `.vb`) to the property name, allowing variations like type names to be accurately represented for different languages. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/spec/metadata_format_spec.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` - uid: System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2 name.csharp: Dictionary name.vb: Dictionary(Of TKey, TValue) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Representing C# Nested Types in YAML DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the YAML mapping for a C# nested enum (`SpecialFolder` within `Environment`). It shows how the `id` for a nested type is formed by concatenating the containing type's name and the nested type's name (`Environment.SpecialFolder`), while the `uid` includes the full namespace. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/dotnet-yaml-format.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` namespace System { public class Environment { public enum SpecialFolder {} } } ``` LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` uid: System.Environment.SpecialFolder id: Environment.SpecialFolder name.csharp: Environment.SpecialFolder fullName.csharp: System.Environment.SpecialFolder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example of Overwrite Section with YAML Header in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to define an Overwrite Section in a Markdown file using a YAML header that starts with a 'uid' property, which identifies the target Model to overwrite. It also demonstrates how to include additional properties and Markdown content using the '*content' anchor. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/tutorial/intro_overwrite_files.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` --- uid: microsoft.com/docfx/Contacts some_property: value --- Further description for `microsoft.com/docfx/Contacts` ``` LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` --- uid: microsoft.com/docfx/Contacts footer: *content --- Footer for `microsoft.com/docfx/Contacts` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring docfx.json to Include Custom API Converter Output DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates how to modify the 'docfx.json' configuration file to include YAML files generated by a custom API converter in the Docfx build process. It specifies the path pattern for YAML files within the 'content' array to ensure they are processed during documentation generation. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/additional-languages.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "build": { "content": [ { "files": "api/**/*.yml" } ], } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filter API by Attribute DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet provides an example of excluding APIs based on the attributes that they have. This specific example excludes all APIs with the `AttributeUsageAttribute`, where its constructor's first argument is `System.AttributeTargets.Class` and the named argument `Inherited` is set to `True`. This is a fine-grained way to filter APIs that are decorated by specific attributes. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/dotnet-api-docs.md#_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiRules: - exclude: hasAttribute: uid: System.AttributeUsageAttribute ctorArguments: - System.AttributeTargets.Class ctorNamedArguments: Inherited: "True" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using @ shorthand for Cross-Referencing in DocFX Markdown DESCRIPTION: Introduces a concise shorthand syntax provided by DocFX for cross-referencing items in Markdown. A string starting with `@` followed immediately by the item's UID enclosed in single (`''`) or double (`""`) quotes is automatically processed as an `xref` reference, simplifying the syntax for linking to documented items. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/spec/metadata_format_spec.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` @"System.String" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Link Text for xref Cross-References in DocFX Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use standard Markdown link syntax to provide custom display text for `xref` cross-references instead of using the item's default name. By placing the desired text in the link's square brackets (`[Dictionary]`) and the `xref:UID` in the parentheses, you can control how the cross-reference appears in the generated documentation. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/spec/metadata_format_spec.md#_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [Dictionary](xref:System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2)<[String](xref:System.String), [String](xref:System.String)> ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring RtfDocumentProcessor Implementing IDocumentProcessor in C# DESCRIPTION: Defines a new class RtfDocumentProcessor exported as an implementation of IDocumentProcessor to be used by DocFX. This class declares that it will handle processing of documents, specifically `.rtf` files. It acts as the entry point for loading, saving, and providing build steps for the RTF file processing pipeline. Implementation of the interface methods is required in subsequent snippets. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/tutorial/howto_build_your_own_type_of_documentation_with_custom_plug-in.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` [Export(typeof(IDocumentProcessor))] public class RtfDocumentProcessor : IDocumentProcessor { // todo : implements IDocumentProcessor. } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Mustache Template to Render View Model Property in DocFX DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows a Mustache template example that renders the _title property from the View Model provided by the transform function. It uses triple curly braces {{{_title}}} to inject the title string into the output without escaping it. When combined with the transform function that sets _title to "Hello World", rendering an input Markdown file named A.md produces a text file A.txt containing the text "Hello World". This demonstrates the linkage between DocFX data transformation and templating for output generation. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/tutorial/intro_template.md#_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: Mustache CODE: ``` {{{_title}}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing PrepareMetadata for DocFX Post-Processor (C#) DESCRIPTION: Implements the `PrepareMetadata` method of the `IPostProcessor` interface in C#. This method allows modifying the global metadata dictionary before DocFX starts building individual files. It receives the current metadata and must return an immutable dictionary with any changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/tutorial/howto_add_a_customized_post_processor.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` public ImmutableDictionary PrepareMetadata(ImmutableDictionary metadata) { // TODO: add/remove/update property from global metadata return metadata; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building and Serving a DocFX Project Locally (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Runs the `docfx` command with the project configuration file (`docfx.json`) and the `--serve` flag. This builds the static site (usually into `_site`) and hosts it locally, typically on http://localhost:8080, for previewing. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/index.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docfx docfx.json --serve ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Preferred Formatting and Style in C# Source Files DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines mandatory formatting guidelines including use of spaces instead of tabs with a tab size of 4, placing using directives inside the namespace declaration, and spacing practices around control statements like for and if. These rules improve code readability and consistency, and are enforced via IDE configuration or tooling such as StyleCop. No external library dependencies required. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/samples/seed/articles/csharp_coding_standards.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` Use spaces over tabs (tab size: 4). Add using directives inside namespace declaration. Example: namespace Microsoft.Content.Build.BuildWorker.UnitTest { using System; } Add a space in for and if statements: for (var i = 0; i < 1; i++) if (a == b) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cross-Platform Coding Recommendations in C# DESCRIPTION: This snippet advises using Environment.NewLine for line breaks instead of hard-coded \r\n sequences to ensure compatibility across Windows, OSX, and Linux. It also recommends using Path.Combine() or Path.DirectorySeparatorChar for file paths; if not possible, using forward slash '/' as a fallback. These practices increase code portability across different operating systems. The expected input is OS-dependent strings, and output is system-correct formatted strings and paths. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/samples/seed/articles/csharp_coding_standards.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` Use Environment.NewLine instead of hard-coded line breaks. Use Path.Combine() or Path.DirectorySeparatorChar to separate directories. Fallback to forward slash '/' only if necessary. Note: Be cautious using @"" text blocks with line breaks as line endings can cause issues. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Static Site with Default Configuration DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to build static site contents using the default docfx.json configuration file. The [!code-[]()] format provides flexible inclusion of code and controls highlighting, language, and selection. This method is executed after the DocFX build process is complete, allowing custom logic to modify or create output files within the specified `outputFolder`, based on the provided `manifest` which lists all generated files. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/tutorial/howto_add_a_customized_post_processor.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` public Manifest Process(Manifest manifest, string outputFolder) { // TODO: add/remove/update all the files included in manifest return manifest; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Local Prerelease DocFX Tool (PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: Uses the `dotnet tool update` command with the `-g` (global), `--prerelease`, and `--source ./` flags to install or update the `docfx` tool from a NuGet package (`.nupkg`) located in the current directory. This is used to install prerelease versions downloaded manually, such as nightly builds obtained via the previous script. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/index.md#_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: pwsh CODE: ``` dotnet tool update docfx -g --prerelease --source ./ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Content Files in docfx.json `build` Section DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the `content` property within the `build` section to define an array of file patterns (supporting glob syntax and File Mappings) that specify which content files (like Markdown or YAML files) should be processed by DocFX. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-json-reference.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "build": { "content": ["**/*.{md,yml}"] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building and Serving Generated Documentation DESCRIPTION: Shows how to build static site contents with the default configuration, then serve the generated site and open it in the default browser. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-cli-reference/docfx-build.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: pwsh CODE: ``` docfx build --serve --open-browser ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing/Updating the DocFX Global Tool (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Uses the .NET CLI to install or update the `docfx` tool globally. This makes the `docfx` command available from any directory in the terminal. Requires the .NET SDK (8.0 or higher) to be installed. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/index.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` dotnet tool update -g docfx ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining C# Generic Class Cat DESCRIPTION: Defines the generic C# class `Cat`. It is marked as `Serializable` and `Obsolete`. The generic parameter T is constrained to be a reference type with a parameterless constructor (`class, new()`), and K is constrained to be a value type (`struct`). The class implements the `ICat` and `IAnimal` interfaces. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/test/docfx.Snapshot.Tests/SamplesTest.SeedMarkdown/CatLibrary.Cat-2.verified.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` [Serializable] [Obsolete] public class Cat : ICat, IAnimal where T : class, new() where K : struct ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Link Colors with CSS Variables (Modern Template) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize the site's link colors in a custom modern template (`my-template/public/main.css`). It overrides default Bootstrap CSS variables (`--bs-link-color-rgb` and `--bs-link-hover-color-rgb`) within the `body` selector to change the appearance of links. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/template.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` /* file: my-template/public/main.css */ body { --bs-link-color-rgb: 66, 184, 131 !important; --bs-link-hover-color-rgb: 64, 180, 128 !important; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running DocFX with Default Configuration in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Example of running DocFX with the default configuration file (docfx.json) to execute metadata, build and pdf commands without additional options. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-cli-reference/docfx.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: pwsh CODE: ``` docfx ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mapping C# Namespaces to YAML Properties DESCRIPTION: Provides a basic C# namespace definition (`System.IO`) and its corresponding YAML representation. It highlights that for namespaces, the `uid`, `id`, `name`, and `fullName` properties typically share the same value, establishing the base identifier for containing types. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/dotnet-yaml-format.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` namespace System.IO { } ``` LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` uid: System.IO id: System.IO name: System.IO fullName: System.IO ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying a Single Template in docfx.json `build` Section DESCRIPTION: Shows how to specify a single template to be used for transforming generated YAML models into output pages. The `template` property is set to the name of the template folder (`custom`). If omitted, the embedded `default` template is used. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-json-reference.md#_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "build": { "template": "custom", } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Embedding Mermaid Diagram in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This Markdown snippet demonstrates how to embed a Mermaid diagram using a code block with the `mermaid` language identifier. The snippet shows a simple flowchart diagram defined using Mermaid syntax. Mermaid diagrams are only supported in the `modern` template. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/markdown.md#_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: md CODE: ``` ```mermaid flowchart LR A[Hard] -->|Text| B(Round) B --> C{Decision} C -->|One| D[Result 1] C -->|Two| E[Result 2] ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Block Markdown Includes - Markdown DESCRIPTION: This markdown snippet shows how to include an entire block of content from another markdown file using the [!INCLUDE] directive on its own line. The block is replaced at build time with the referenced file's full content. It accepts a title and filepath and is often used for section-level reuse. The included file should not be built separately and must exist at the specified relative path. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/markdown.md#_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [!INCLUDE [](<filepath>)] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining File-Specific Metadata in docfx.json `build` Section DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates configuring file-specific metadata using the `fileMetadata` property within the `build` section. It allows associating metadata values (like `priority`, `keywords`, `_noindex`) with files matching specific glob patterns. This provides fine-grained control over metadata per file or file group. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-json-reference.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "build": { "fileMetadata": { "priority": { "**.md": 2.5, "spec/**.md": 3 }, "keywords": { "obj/docfx/**": ["API", "Reference"], "spec/**.md": ["Spec", "Conceptual"] }, "_noindex": { "articles/**/article.md": true } } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Docfx as NuGet Package DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to include Docfx as a NuGet package in a .NET project. It specifies the package name and version to be installed. This is a prerequisite for customizing Markdig markdown extensions programmatically. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/markdown.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` <PackageReference Include="Docfx.App" Version="2.70.0" /> ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring Application Entry Point with Main Method - CSharp - C# DESCRIPTION: This snippet implements the static Main method, the standard entry point for C# console applications. It takes a string array 'args' as its parameter, allowing input arguments during program execution. No dependencies are required aside from standard C# libraries, and the method returns void. Inputs: string[] args. Output: none (void). This method should be present in the top-level class to launch the application; its body is not detailed here. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/test/docfx.Snapshot.Tests/SamplesTest.SeedMarkdown/BuildFromCSharpSourceCode.CSharp.verified.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` public static void Main(string[] args) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring PDF per TOC in toc.yml DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure PDF generation directly within a `toc.yml` file. Setting `pdf: true` enables PDF generation for the specific table of contents. This allows for selective PDF generation for different sections of the documentation. It requires a valid `toc.yml` file with valid `items`. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/pdf.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` pdf: true items: - name: Getting Started href: getting-started.md ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Docfx .NET API Generation NuGet Package via XML DESCRIPTION: This XML snippet shows how to include the Docfx.Dotnet package version 2.62.0 as a NuGet dependency in a project. This package is required to access the Docfx .NET API generation functionalities programmatically. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/dotnet-api-docs.md#_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: XML CODE: ``` <PackageReference Include="Docfx.Dotnet" Version="2.62.0" /> ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Highlight.js in Modern Template JS DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize the highlight.js library for syntax highlighting within a modern template's `main.js` (`my-template/public/main.js`). Customizations, such as registering new languages, are performed within the exported object's `configureHljs` function, which receives the `hljs` object. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/template.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` export default { configureHljs: (hljs) => { // Customize hightlight.js here }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Global Metadata in docfx.json `build` Section DESCRIPTION: Explains how to set key-value pairs of global metadata using the `globalMetadata` property within the `build` section. This metadata is applied to every file processed during the build. The example defines `_appTitle` and `_enableSearch`. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-json-reference.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "build": { "globalMetadata": { "_appTitle": "DocFX website", "_enableSearch": "true" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: CSS Print Media Styles for PDF Customization DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides an example of using CSS print media queries (`@media print`) to customize the styling of PDF pages. This allows you to apply specific styles when generating the PDF, such as adjusting margins, fonts, and background graphics, to control the appearance of the document. This will be used in conjunction with the HTML template used by Docfx. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/pdf.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` @media print { /* All your print styles go here */ } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running DocFX with Web Server and Browser in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Example of running DocFX with all default commands, then serving the generated site and opening it in the default web browser for immediate preview. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-cli-reference/docfx.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: pwsh CODE: ``` docfx --serve --open-browser ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Copyright Header - JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates the required copyright header for all JavaScript files. This class must be public and static, and should not be generic. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/test/docfx.Snapshot.Tests/SamplesTest.SeedMarkdown/CatLibrary.ICatExtension.verified.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` public static class ICatExtension ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Saving Document Model to Output in RtfDocumentProcessor Using C# DESCRIPTION: Implements the Save method which writes the processed content from the model to the specified output file. This typically outputs the transformed content such as HTML to disk. The method accesses the model dictionary for the key "content" and writes it to the output location. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/tutorial/howto_build_your_own_type_of_documentation_with_custom_plug-in.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` public SaveResult Save(FileAndType file, object model, string outputFolder) { var dict = model as Dictionary<string, object>; var content = dict?["content"] as string ?? string.Empty; var outputPath = Path.Combine(outputFolder, Path.ChangeExtension(file.File, ".html")); File.WriteAllText(outputPath, content); return new SaveResult(outputPath); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Copyright Header - CSS DESCRIPTION: This code snippet presents the required copyright header for CSS files. It includes licensing information from the .NET Foundation under the MIT license. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/samples/seed/articles/engineering_guidelines.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` /** * Licensed to the .NET Foundation under one or more agreements. * The .NET Foundation licenses this file to you under the MIT license. */ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Output Groups in docfx.json `build` Section DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the `groups` property within the `build` section to define named output groups. Each key is a group name (e.g., `v1`), and the value specifies configuration for that group, such as a custom output destination directory (`dest`). SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-json-reference.md#_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "groups": { "v1": { "dest": "output_dir_v1" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Structure of docfx.json DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the fundamental top-level structure of the `docfx.json` file. It outlines the primary configuration sections: `build` for build-related settings, `metadata` for metadata extraction settings, and `pdf` for PDF generation settings (details not shown). All relative paths within the file are relative to its location. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-json-reference.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "build": { }, "metadata": { }, "pdf": { } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Name Property for RtfDocumentProcessor in C# DESCRIPTION: Defines a simple Name property returning a constant string identifying the processor. This name is used for logging and diagnostics within the DocFX build process. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/tutorial/howto_build_your_own_type_of_documentation_with_custom_plug-in.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` public string Name => "RtfDocumentProcessor"; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: DFM Note Callout with Code Block - Markdown DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how a note callout ([!NOTE]) with an indented code block appears in Markdown. In DocFX Flavored Markdown (DFM), the code block is rendered as a code note, while in GitHub Flavored Markdown (GFM), it is treated as a plain blockquote. The example demonstrates cross-rendering differences and should be used to highlight important code remarks in documentation. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/markdown.md#_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: md CODE: ``` > [!NOTE] > This is code. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining a Simple CSharp Class - CSharp - C# DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a public class named CSharp, serving as a minimal container for additional functionality or as an application entry point. The class inherits directly from the System.Object base class. No member variables or methods are declared here aside from what is defined elsewhere in the file. Suitable for demonstrating class declaration syntax and establishing type structure in C#. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/test/docfx.Snapshot.Tests/SamplesTest.SeedMarkdown/BuildFromCSharpSourceCode.CSharp.verified.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` public class CSharp ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading an xrefmap File with docfx download (PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: Provides an example of downloading a specific xrefmap file from a URL using the `--xref` option and saving it locally as `xrefmap.zip`. The command requires the destination path (`xrefmap.zip`) and the URL of the remote xrefmap file (`.json` or `.yml`). Note that the downloaded file is always archived as `.zip` containing `xrefmap.yml`. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/reference/docfx-cli-reference/docfx-download.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: pwsh CODE: ``` docfx download xrefmap.zip --xref https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/raw/main/.xrefmap.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Tab Group Markup for Platform-Specific Content - Markdown DESCRIPTION: This snippet presents the markdown syntax for creating tabbed content sections, for instance to differentiate Linux and Windows documentation. Each tab uses a header with a Markdown link in the format '# [Display Name](#tab/id)'. The set is separated from the rest of the file by '---'. Switching tabs synchronizes content display based on the tab ID. No dependencies required beyond DocFX markdown support. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/markdown.md#_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # [Linux](#tab/linux) Content for Linux... # [Windows](#tab/windows) Content for Windows... --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining C# Public Indexer Property for Cat DESCRIPTION: Defines a public indexer property for the `Cat<T, K>` class that takes a string key and returns/sets an integer value. The `get` accessor is protected, while the `set` accessor is public. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/test/docfx.Snapshot.Tests/SamplesTest.SeedMarkdown/CatLibrary.Cat-2.verified.md#_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` public int this[string a] { protected get; set; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Custom Filter Rule for API Exclusion by UID DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet shows an example of a custom filter rule that excludes APIs by matching a regular expression against their UID. In this example, all APIs with UIDs starting with `Microsoft.DevDiv` are excluded, except for those whose UIDs start with `Microsoft.DevDiv.SpecialCase`. This is used to refine the API documentation by selective filtering. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/dotnet-api-docs.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiRules: - include: uidRegex: ^Microsoft\.DevDiv\.SpecialCase - exclude: uidRegex: ^Microsoft\.DevDiv ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Site Build Content and Resources in Docfx with JSON DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet configures the docfx.json 'build' section to specify which content files (Markdown and YAML) to transform into HTML and which static resource files to copy as-is. It uses glob patterns for file matching and excludes specified folders to control the scope of site content and resources during the build process. Dependencies include having a Docfx site directory with docfx.json. This will render as a math expression within the same line of text. MathJax is required for the correct rendering in the `modern` template. It covers nested objects such as 'Source', 'GitSource', 'Commit', 'User', 'Exception', and 'LinkInfo'. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/tutorial/intro_overwrite_files.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: YAML CODE: ``` uid: string # Unique identifier for the Model, with merge behavior assemblies: string[] # Ignored during overwrite attributes: [Attribute] # Ignored during overwrite children: uid[] # Ignored during overwrite documentation: [Source] # Merge example: string[] # Replace exceptions: [Exception] # Merge keyed list fullName: string # Replace fullName.<lang>: string # Replace id: string # Replace implements: uid[] # Ignored inheritance: uid[] # Ignored inheritedMembers: uid[] # Ignored isEii: boolean # Replace isExtensionMethod: boolean # Replace langs: string[] # Replace modifiers.<lang>: string[] # Ignored name: string # Replace name.<lang>: string # Replace namespace: uid # Replace overridden: uid # Replace parent: uid # Replace platform: string[] # Replace remarks: markdown # Replace see: [LinkInfo] # Merge keyed list seealso: [LinkInfo] # Merge keyed list source: [Source] # Merge syntax: [Syntax] # Merge summary: markdown # Replace type: string # Replace # Nested property example: Source base: string # Replace content: string # Replace endLine: integer # Replace id: string # Replace isExternal: boolean # Replace href: string # Replace path: string # Replace remote: [GitSource] # Merge startLine: integer # Replace # Nested property: GitSource path: string # Replace branch: string # Replace repo: url # Replace commit: [Commit] # Merge key: string # Replace # Nested property: Commit committer: [User] # Replace author: [User] # Replace id: string # Replace message: string # Replace # Nested property: User name: string # Replace email: string # Replace date: datetime # Replace # Nested property: Exception type: uid # Merge key description: markdown # Replace commentId: string # Ignored # Nested property: LinkInfo linkId: uid or href # Merge key altText: markdown # Replace commentId: string # Ignore linkType: enum(`CRef` or `HRef`) # Ignore ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: IAnimal Eat() Method DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines the Eat() method of the IAnimal interface. It uses an Ubuntu VM, installs the .NET SDK (version 8.x), installs the global DocFX tool, builds the documentation using the `docfx build` command, and then executes a Bash script to deploy the built site to GitHub Pages. It relies on a variable group named `GitHubPAT` containing the secret `GITHUB_PAT`. SOURCE: https://github.com/dotnet/docfx/blob/main/docs/docs/publish-azure-devops.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` trigger: branches: include: - main # Trigger on main branch pool: vmImage: 'ubuntu-latest' # Use the latest Ubuntu VM variables: - group: GitHubPAT steps: # Step 1: Install DocFX - task: UseDotNet@2 inputs: packageType: 'sdk' version: '8.x' # Ensure you have .NET SDK installed installationPath: $(Agent.ToolsDirectory)/dotnet - script: | dotnet tool install -g docfx displayName: 'Install DocFX' # Step 2: Build the Documentation using DocFX - script: | docfx build displayName: 'Build Documentation' # Step 3: Deploy to GitHub Pages - task: Bash@3 displayName: 'Deploy to GitHub Pages' inputs: targetType: 'inline' script: | git config --global user.email "your-email@example.com" git config --global user.name "Your Name" git clone --branch gh-pages https://$GITHUB_PAT@github.com/$GITHUB_REPO.git out rm -rf out/* cp -r _site/* out/ cd out git add --all git commit -m "Update documentation" git push origin gh-pages env: GITHUB_PAT: $(GITHUB_PAT) # The GitHub Personal Access Token GITHUB_REPO: your-github-username/your-repo-name # Update with your repo details ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: YAML Frontmatter Documentation Overwrite for CatLibrary.Cat Generic Class Constructor DESCRIPTION: A DocFX documentation overwrite that specifies a unique identifier for the Cat class constructor with two generic parameters and provides a custom summary text to replace the original documentation.
